Class FilterCriteria

java.lang.Object
bto.EntitiesProjectRelated.FilterCriteria
public class FilterCriteria extends Object
The FilterCriteria class provides a flexible way to define and apply filtering criteria for BTO housing entities like projects, applications, and bookings.

It stores key-value pairs representing various filtering conditions that can be used by controllers and report generators to filter collections of objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • FilterCriteria

      public FilterCriteria()
      Default constructor for FilterCriteria. Initializes an empty criteria map.

  • Method Details

    • addCriterion

      public boolean addCriterion(String key, Object value)
      Adds a criterion to the filter.
      Parameters:
      key - The name of the criterion (e.g., "project", "flatType", "maritalStatus")
      value - The value to filter by (e.g., a Project object, FlatType enum, MaritalStatus enum)
      Returns:
      true indicating the criterion was added successfully

    • removeCriterion

      public boolean removeCriterion(String key)
      Removes a criterion from the filter.
      Parameters:
      key - The name of the criterion to remove
      Returns:
      true if the criterion was removed successfully, false if it didn't exist

    • ownProjects

      public List<Project> ownProjects(List<Project> allProjects, HDBManager currentManager)
      Filters a list of projects to find those that belong to a specific HDB manager.
      Parameters:
      allProjects - The complete list of projects to filter
      currentManager - The HDB manager whose projects should be included in the result
      Returns:
      A filtered list containing only projects managed by the specified manager

    • getCriteria

      public Map<String,Object> getCriteria()
      Gets the map of all criteria currently defined in this filter.
      Returns:
      A map where keys are criterion names and values are the filter values

    • matches

      public boolean matches(Object obj)
      Checks if an object matches all the criteria defined in this filter. This is a placeholder method that currently always returns false.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to check against the criteria
      Returns:
      true if the object matches all criteria, false otherwise

    • setCriteria

      public void setCriteria(Map<String,Object> criteria)
      Sets the criteria map to a new map. This replaces any existing criteria.
      Parameters:
      criteria - The new criteria map to set
